sentences:
Iva imbricata is a North American species of flowering plant in the aster family known by the common names dune marsh - elder and seacoast marsh elder .
It is native to Cuba , the Bahamas , and coastal areas of the United States from Texas to Virginia .
It is a low shrub , found on sand dunes and the upper beach .
It is a highly salt tolerant plant , and is often the perennial plant closest to the ocean .
Iva imbricata is an important species for dune stabilization and can easily be propagated by cuttings .
It sometimes grows up to 100   cm ( 40 inches ) tall .
It produces numerous flower heads in elongated arrays , each head with 2 - 17 disc flowers but no ray flowers .
